page.title: 16CONSTANTINE LANDSCAPE 2
page.content: ARCHITECTURAL FEATURES;There is a great variety of architecture in the village.The earliest buildings date from the 17th century.This is the house belonging to the Fox family at Trewerdreva.Many of the cottages along Fore street were originally miners cottages built in the 18th century of granite blocks.Some of the outlying farm houses were also built in the 17th century,of wattle a mixture of mud and manure.The houses around the church, originally Church town,are built of rough granite boulders unhewn.In the early 19th century some premises were built of red brick in Victorian design at Ponjeravah.After the war 1945 modern houses were built at Trebarvah close and on Penbothidno estate of concrete blocks made from china clay waste.Estates were built recently on the Bowling Green area.
